pull.title: ci: Print inner env, Make ccache config more flexible
pull.body:
The outer env is printed when the `/tmp/env-$USER-$CONTAINER_NAME` is created. There is also a separate env printed when building the container image (usually with default values).

To confirm that the inner container env is correctly derived from the outer env, and not from the default build env, print it a third time.

committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726137242 +0200

ci: Bump default CCACHE_MAXSIZE to 500M

This also allows to drop individually hardcoded values, which are
impossible to overwrite and hard to maintain.

events.message:
ci: Bump default CCACHE_MAXSIZE to 500M

This also allows to drop individually hardcoded values, which are
impossible to overwrite and hard to maintain.

verification.payload:
tree 51c975d436a50fd7b6339bb57fcfc3fafa8cc201
parent fa146904e19e345714fd40fd2f0fbad8118957b9
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726058527 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726137255 +0200

ci: Remove hardcoded CCACHE_DIR in cirrus

This makes it easier to overwrite the value.

Also, drop the dot in the CCACHE_DIR fallback value, because the folder
in the scratch dir does not need and probably should not be hidden.

events.message:
ci: Remove hardcoded CCACHE_DIR in cirrus

This makes it easier to overwrite the value.

Also, drop the dot in the CCACHE_DIR fallback value, because the folder
in the scratch dir does not need and probably should not be hidden.

verification.payload:
tree b922d3ded1ed7e90e975dd2f65bf2f6ffc675407
parent fa252da0b9cc6c7e795366ce4a1ddc4c198dff15
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726061483 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1726499997 +0200

ci: Allow CCACHE_DIR bind mount

This may be useful. For example, to store the directory in a specific
place, instead of having to use a volume.

Possibly, but not limited to sharing a cache:
https://ccache.dev/manual/4.10.1.html#_sharing_a_local_cache

events.message:
ci: Allow CCACHE_DIR bind mount

This may be useful. For example, to store the directory in a specific
place, instead of having to use a volume.

Possibly, but not limited to sharing a cache:
https://ccache.dev/manual/4.10.1.html#_sharing_a_local_cache

events.body:
ACK fa99e4521b6fc0e7f6636d40bc0d6a7325227374

Making ccache mor configurable in CI seems like a reasonable change overall. Hopefully in the future this could help us if we moved to some more powerful CI runners (with bigger ccache!)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +48,12 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
     CI_PREVIOUS_RELEASES_MOUNT="type=bind,src=${PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR},dst=$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR"
   fi
 
+  if [ "$DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_CCACHE_FOLDER" ]; then
+    # Same as above, but only for ccache
+    mkdir -p "${CCACHE_DIR}"
+    CI_CCACHE_MOUNT="type=bind,src=${CCACHE_DIR},dst=$CCACHE_DIR"
comments.body:
nit: are you using the two separate variable reference styles because the second one doesn't have any characters after it? To be fair, the first also ends with a `,` so I think we can simplify this:
```suggestion
    CI_CCACHE_MOUNT="type=bind,src=$CCACHE_DIR,dst=$CCACHE_DIR"
```

This is sourced usually through `test_run_all.sh`, right?
What was the reason for such low values before?
the dot is dropped since it's not a [home dir](https://ccache.dev/manual/latest.html#config_cache_dir), right?

nit: commit message has subject-verb agreement problem
> the build path**s** are constant

Yes.

I do not know. I presume this is just the initial value that was set when there were no debug builds or builds with sanitizers (which are larger).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +48,12 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
     CI_PREVIOUS_RELEASES_MOUNT="type=bind,src=${PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR},dst=$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR"
   fi
 
+  if [ "$DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_CCACHE_FOLDER" ]; then
+    # Same as above, but only for ccache
+    mkdir -p "${CCACHE_DIR}"
+    CI_CCACHE_MOUNT="type=bind,src=${CCACHE_DIR},dst=$CCACHE_DIR"
comments.body: Nah, it was just copy-pasted from above. Fixed the style here.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +48,15 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
     CI_PREVIOUS_RELEASES_MOUNT="type=bind,src=${PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR},dst=$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR"
   fi
 
+  if [ "$DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_CCACHE_FOLDER" ]; then
+    # Same as above, but only for ccache
comments.body: this doesn't seem to be the case anymore, the above ones recreate the folders

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,6 +48,15 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
     CI_PREVIOUS_RELEASES_MOUNT="type=bind,src=${PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR},dst=$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR"
   fi
 
+  if [ "$DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_CCACHE_FOLDER" ]; then
+    # Same as above, but only for ccache
comments.body:
I meant the "bind-mount" part, not the folder creation. (I think creating the folder is best required to be done outside the script, as permission bits need to be set appropriately)

I guess I can just remove the comment?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -30,6 +30,10 @@ df -h
 # Tests that run natively guess the host
 export HOST=${HOST:-$("$BASE_ROOT_DIR/depends/config.guess")}
 
+echo "=== BEGIN env ==="
+env
+echo "=== END env ==="
comments.body:
This does work, but seems to come out a little garbled in the raw logs on CI itself. It didn't happen for me locally and it does not appear to be fault of the script itself, so I guess just GitHub UI processing stdout slowly or something, e.g. 

```log
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4198819Z + echo '=== END env ==='
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4199084Z + tee /dev/fd/63
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4199339Z ++ patch -p1
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4199590Z + '[' false = true ']'
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4199872Z + '[' true = true ']'
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4200388Z + export DIR_UNIT_TEST_DATA=/home/runner/work/_temp/ci/scratch/qa-assets/unit_test_data/
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4201123Z + DIR_UNIT_TEST_DATA=/home/runner/work/_temp/ci/scratch/qa-assets/unit_test_data/
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4201953Z + '[' '!' -d /home/runner/work/_temp/ci/scratch/qa-assets/unit_test_data/ ']'
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4202600Z + mkdir -p /home/runner/work/_temp/ci/scratch/qa-assets/unit_test_data/
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4204159Z + retry -- curl --location --fail https://github.com/bitcoin-core/qa-assets/raw/main/unit_test_data/script_assets_test.json -o /home/runner/work/_temp/ci/scratch/qa-assets/unit_test_data//script_assets_test.json
2024-09-16T15:22:03.4205183Z === END env ===
```
